My son inherited the motor gene from me so I was not surprised that he called and said he had just picked up a motorcycle for my 6-year old grandson. It is really a nice little machine, a 50cc Yamaha with auto trans and shaft drive. My son's house is on an acre so there is lots of yard for him to ride on and he is only allowed on it with Dad present. He looks like a little space man scooting around the yard with that full-face helmet on. I got on and took it for a spin and it had no problem hauling my big butt around the yard. The throttle can be adjusted to limit the speed, but that option probably won't be used much. I was around 11 when I got my first motor vehicle, a Whizzer motorbike.

I started out a little Honda Z50, like a million other kids. Riding around in the yard and hills around our cottage.
 
 Went from there to various other 80cc bikes my dad would collect and restore. I had a real nice Suzuki 80 for a while.
 
 I bought a 1986 Yamaha DT200 when I was 14. I worked like a dog all year to save up $1600 for that thing. I put almost 25,000 kms (15,000 miles) on that bike before I sold it when I was 17 to buy a truck. There wasn't a back road, trail, or secret entrance within 20 miles of the cottage I didn't know like the back of my hand.
 
 I went without a bike until '01, bought snowmobiles instead. I bought my current bike, an '01 Suzuki DRZ400E that spring. I put some turn signals and a horn on it and got a license plate. I ride it whenever I get the chance, even to work, but I dont get out nearly as much as I'd like to.
 
 I miss the freedom I had roaming around on a bike back then......

When they arrived, my son's partner was there with a 50cc Kawasaki he had bought for his son, Soon the two grown men were racing around a wheat field on the tiny machines.
